alert.note: Alert for Inland Miami-Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade County through 900 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Richmond Heights, or over Kendall, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Coral Gables, South Miami, Black Point, Kendall, The Redland, Doral, Pinecrest, Sweetwater, West Miami, Westchester, Glenvar Heights, Fountainbleau, Richmond Heights, Palmetto Bay, Cutler Bay, University Of Miami, Zoo Miami, Goulds and West Perrine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
